title: [K-12] Workshop on Reinforcement Learning-Based Phononic Crystal Beam Edge State Design

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic wave mechanics, finite element analysis (FEA) concepts, and fundamental principles of machine learning
context.additional_context: Course for teachers exploring advanced acoustic metamaterial design techniques applicable to physics education settings

learning_goals: Optimize bandgap structures of phononic crystal beams using reinforcement learning models.
Apply methodologies to derive edge state frequencies through eigenmode analysis.
Evaluate elastic wave propagation characteristics of designed edge states via full structural analysis.

resources: COMSOL Multiphysics or similar FEA software
Pre-built phononic crystal beam simulation templates

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
